definition: loyal advice jars on the ears (idiom)

sentences.english: The feeling is supposed to come after we're done. We're supposed to feel good by accomplishing.
sentences.chinese: 然而，要是你一点也不想听那些逆耳忠言怎么办？

sentences.english: Is this because the majority just won't listen to reason?
sentences.chinese: 难道仅仅是因为大众不听信忠言？

sentences.english: What most works for one's growth is honest advice unpleasant to the ear.
sentences.chinese: 最有助于一个人成长的是逆耳忠言。

sentences.english: I talk to him with brutal frankness.
sentences.chinese: 本人对他讲的话，固然逆耳，倒是忠言。

sentences.english: Better words don?t harm to us , if you can follow them.
sentences.chinese: 忠言对我们无害，假如你能听进去的话。

sentences.english: It is time for the CPC who boast himself to be great, glorious and correct to wake up.
sentences.chinese: 忠言逆耳，一贯自诩伟大光荣正确的中共，该醒了。

sentences.english: Bitter medicine cures sickness; unpalataBle advice Benefits conduct.
sentences.chinese: 良药苦口利于病，忠言逆耳益于行。

sentences.english: He is deaf to your earnest advice.
Ok, today the topic of my speech is "Bad Words Did Good Things."
sentences.chinese: 那么，今天我演讲的题目是“忠言逆耳”。

sentences.english: Write down the advice of him that coves you , though you like it not at present.
sentences.chinese: 爱你的忠言且记下，即使你目前不起它。

sentences.english: Unless his conduct improves, he'll have to be told a few home truths.
sentences.chinese: 除非他的行为有所改进，否则他就得听到逆耳忠言。

definition: loyal advice jars on the ears (idiom)
speech that grates on the ear (idiom); bitter truths/home truths (that one does not want to hear)
unpleasant to hear/grates on the ear (of home truths)
to put forward a suggestion (to sb in a senior position)/to offer a word of advice
to remonstrate/to warn earnestly (esp. classical written Chinese)/to exhort
words from the bottom of one's heart
